name: Viral YouTube Clipper
description: Automatically download and clip YouTube videos based on user defined clip duration and topic. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
# Import necessary modules and classes
from axiestudio.schema import Record
from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from pytube import YouTube
from youtube_transcript_api import YouTubeTranscriptApi
import os

class YouTubeDownloader(CustomComponent):
    # Metadata for the component
    display_name = "YouTube Downloader and Transcript Builder"
    description = "Download a YouTube video and gets its transcript"
    icon = "üìπ"

    def build_config(self):
        # Configuration for the component
        return {
            "youtube_url": {
                "type": "text",
                "label": "YouTube URL",
                "placeholder": "Enter the URL of the YouTube video",
            }
        }

    def build(self, youtube_url: str) -> Record:
        try:
            # Initialize YouTube object with the provided URL
            yt = YouTube(youtube_url)
            # Filter for a specific stream (e.g., 720p mp4)
            video = yt.streams.filter(file_extension='mp4').first()
            if not video:
                raise Exception("No suitable video stream found.")
            
            # Sanitize the video title for safe file naming
            safe_title = yt.title.replace(' ', '_')
            filename = f"downloaded_video/{safe_title}.mp4"
            
            # Ensure the 'downloaded_video' directory exists
            os.makedirs('downloaded_video', exist_ok=True)
            
            # Download the video
            video.download(filename=filename)

            # # Retrieve the video ID and transcript
            video_id = yt.video_id
            transcript = YouTubeTranscriptApi.get_transcript(video_id)
            # print(transcript)
            
             # Save the segment labels to a text file
            os.makedirs('transcripts', exist_ok=True)
            
            with open('transcripts/transcript.json', 'w') as f:
                json.dump(transcript, f, indent=4)
            
            # Return the Record with the video path and transcript
            return Record(video_path=filename, filename=filename, transcript=transcript)
        
        except Exception as e:
            # Handle errors appropriately
            return Record(error=str(e))
code.name: code

from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.schema import Record
from typing import List
from langchain_core.pydantic_v1 import BaseModel, Field
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI


class TranscriptAnalyzer(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "Transcript"
    description = "Analyze the transcript and identify video clips"
    icon="ü™Ñ"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "record": {
                "type": "record",
                "label": "Input Record",
                "placeholder": "Provide the Record with the transcript and video path",
            },
            "api_key": {
                "type": "text",
                "label": "OpenAI API Key",
                "placeholder": "Enter your OpenAI API key",
            },
            "prompt": {
                "type": "text",
                "label": "Input",
                "placeholder": "Prompt",
            },
        }

    def build(self, record: Record, api_key: str, prompt: str) -> Record:
        # Initialize the LLM
        llm = ChatOpenAI(
            model="gpt-4o",
            temperature=0.7,
            max_tokens=None,
            timeout=None,
            max_retries=2,
            api_key=api_key
        )
        
        print(prompt)

        # Analyze the transcript
        prompt = f"{prompt}\n\nHere is the Transcription:\n{record.transcript}"
        messages = [
            {"role": "system", "content": "You are a Viral Content Producer. You are master at reading youtube transcripts and identifying the most intriguing content."},
            {"role": "user", "content": prompt}
        ]
        class Segment(BaseModel):
            """Represents a segment of a video."""
        
            start_time: float = Field(..., description="The start time of the segment in seconds.")
            end_time: float = Field(..., description="The end time of the segment in seconds.")
            yt_title: str = Field(..., description="The youtube title to make this segment as a viral sub-topic")
            description: str = Field(..., description="The detailed youtube description to make this segment viral")
            duration: int = Field(..., description="The duration of the segment in seconds.")
        
        class VideoTranscript(BaseModel):
            """Represents the transcript of a video with identified viral segments."""
            segments: List[Segment] = Field(..., description="A list of viral segments in the video.")

        structured_llm = llm.with_structured_output(VideoTranscript)
        ai_msg = structured_llm.invoke(messages)
        print(ai_msg)
        parsed_content = ai_msg.dict()["segments"]
        # Add the segment data to the Record
        record.segments = parsed_content
        return record
code.name: code

code.value:
import subprocess
import json
from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.schema import Record
import os

class VideoSegmenter(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "Video Segmenter and Data Saver"
    description = "Segments the video and saves the segment data to disk"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "record": {
                "type": "record",
                "label": "Input Record",
                "placeholder": "Provide the Record with the transcript, video path, and segments",
            }
        }

    def build(self, record: Record) -> Record:
        # Ensure the 'generated_clips' directory exists
        os.makedirs('generated_clips', exist_ok=True)

        # Segment the video and prepare segment labels
        segment_labels = []
        video_title = record.video_title
        for i, segment in enumerate(record.segments):
            start_time = segment['start_time']
            end_time = segment['end_time']
            yt_title = segment['yt_title'] #.replace(' ', '_')  # Replace spaces with underscores
            description = segment['description']
            duration = segment['duration']

            output_file = f"generated_clips/{video_title}_{str(i).zfill(3)}.mp4"
            # command = f"ffmpeg -i {record.video_path} -ss {start_time} -to {end_time} -c copy {output_file}"
            command = f"ffmpeg -i {record.video_path} -ss {start_time} -to {end_time} -c:v libx264 -c:a aac -strict experimental -b:a 192k {output_file}"
            subprocess.call(command, shell=True)

            # Add segment label
            segment_labels.append(f"Sub-Topic {i+1}: {yt_title}, Duration: {duration}s\nDescription: {description}\n")

        # Save the segment labels to a text file
        with open('generated_clips/segment_labels.txt', 'w') as f:
            for label in segment_labels:
                f.write(label + "\n")

        # Save the segment data to a JSON file
        with open('generated_clips/segments.json', 'w') as f:
            json.dump(record.segments, f, indent=4)

        # Add the filename to the record
        record.filename = record.video_path.split('/')[-1]

        return record
code.name: code

from typing import Optional

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from typing import Union


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat input as record"
    icon = "ChatInput"

    def build_config(self):
        build_config = super().build_config()
        build_config["input_value"] = {
            "input_types": [],
            "display_name": "Text",
            "multiline": True,
        }
        build_config["return_message"] = {
            "display_name": "Return Record",
            "advanced": True,
        }

        return build_config

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "User",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "User",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        files: Optional[list[str]] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_message: Optional[bool] = True,
    ) -> Union[Message, Text]:
        return super().build_with_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            files=files,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_message=return_message,
        )
code.name: code

code.value:
from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import TemplateField
from axiestudio.field_typing.prompt import Prompt


class PromptComponent(CustomComponent):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "template": TemplateField(display_name="Template"),
            "code": TemplateField(advanced=True),
        }

    async def build(
        self,
        template: Prompt,
        **kwargs,
    ) -> Prompt:
        prompt = await Prompt.from_template_and_variables(template, kwargs)  # type: ignore
        self.status = prompt.format_text()
        return prompt
code.name: code

Make sure each segment is between {Duration} in duration. 

Make sure you provide extremely accurate timestamps and respond only in the format provided.

from pytube import YouTube
from youtube_transcript_api import YouTubeTranscriptApi
import os

class YouTubeDownloader(CustomComponent):
    # Metadata for the component

                raise Exception("No suitable video stream found.")

from axiestudio.schema import Record
from typing import List
from langchain_core.pydantic_v1 import BaseModel, Field
from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI


class TranscriptAnalyzer(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "Transcript"
    description = "Analyze the transcript and identify video clips"
    icon="ü™Ñ"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "record": {
                "type": "record",
                "label": "Input Record",
                "placeholder": "Provide the Record with the transcript and video path",
            },
            "api_key": {
                "type": "text",
                "label": "OpenAI API Key",
                "placeholder": "Enter your OpenAI API key",
            },
            "prompt": {
                "type": "text",
                "label": "Input",
                "placeholder": "Prompt",
            },
        }

    def build(self, record: Record, api_key: str, prompt: str) -> Record:
        # Initialize the LLM
        llm = ChatOpenAI(
            model="gpt-4o",
            temperature=0.7,
            max_tokens=None,
            timeout=None,
            max_retries=2,
            api_key=api_key
        )
        
        print(prompt)

        # Analyze the transcript
        prompt = f"{prompt}\n\nHere is the Transcription:\n{record.transcript}"
        messages = [
            {"role": "system", "content": "You are a Viral Content Producer. You are master at reading youtube transcripts and identifying the most intriguing content."},
            {"role": "user", "content": prompt}
        ]
        class Segment(BaseModel):
            """Represents a segment of a video."""
        
            start_time: float = Field(..., description="The start time of the segment in seconds.")
            end_time: float = Field(..., description="The end time of the segment in seconds.")
            yt_title: str = Field(..., description="The youtube title to make this segment as a viral sub-topic")
            description: str = Field(..., description="The detailed youtube description to make this segment viral")
            duration: int = Field(..., description="The duration of the segment in seconds.")
        
        class VideoTranscript(BaseModel):
            """Represents the transcript of a video with identified viral segments."""
            segments: List[Segment] = Field(..., description="A list of viral segments in the video.")

        structured_llm = llm.with_structured_output(VideoTranscript)
        ai_msg = structured_llm.invoke(messages)
        print(ai_msg)
        parsed_content = ai_msg.dict()["segments"]
        # Add the segment data to the Record
        record.segments = parsed_content
        return record

import subprocess
import json
from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.schema import Record
import os

class VideoSegmenter(CustomComponent):
    display_name = "Video Segmenter and Data Saver"
    description = "Segments the video and saves the segment data to disk"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "record": {
                "type": "record",
                "label": "Input Record",
                "placeholder": "Provide the Record with the transcript, video path, and segments",
            }
        }

    def build(self, record: Record) -> Record:
        # Ensure the 'generated_clips' directory exists
        os.makedirs('generated_clips', exist_ok=True)

        # Segment the video and prepare segment labels
        segment_labels = []
        video_title = record.video_title
        for i, segment in enumerate(record.segments):
            start_time = segment['start_time']
            end_time = segment['end_time']
            yt_title = segment['yt_title'] #.replace(' ', '_')  # Replace spaces with underscores
            description = segment['description']
            duration = segment['duration']

            output_file = f"generated_clips/{video_title}_{str(i).zfill(3)}.mp4"
            # command = f"ffmpeg -i {record.video_path} -ss {start_time} -to {end_time} -c copy {output_file}"
            command = f"ffmpeg -i {record.video_path} -ss {start_time} -to {end_time} -c:v libx264 -c:a aac -strict experimental -b:a 192k {output_file}"
            subprocess.call(command, shell=True)

            # Add segment label
            segment_labels.append(f"Sub-Topic {i+1}: {yt_title}, Duration: {duration}s\nDescription: {description}\n")

        # Save the segment labels to a text file
        with open('generated_clips/segment_labels.txt', 'w') as f:
            for label in segment_labels:
                f.write(label + "\n")

        # Save the segment data to a JSON file
        with open('generated_clips/segments.json', 'w') as f:
            json.dump(record.segments, f, indent=4)

        # Add the filename to the record
        record.filename = record.video_path.split('/')[-1]

        return record

from typing import Optional

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from typing import Union


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat input as record"
    icon = "ChatInput"

    def build_config(self):
        build_config = super().build_config()
        build_config["input_value"] = {
            "input_types": [],
            "display_name": "Text",
            "multiline": True,
        }
        build_config["return_message"] = {
            "display_name": "Return Record",
            "advanced": True,
        }

        return build_config

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "User",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "User",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        files: Optional[list[str]] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_message: Optional[bool] = True,
    ) -> Union[Message, Text]:
        return super().build_with_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            files=files,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_message=return_message,
        )

from axiestudio.custom import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import TemplateField
from axiestudio.field_typing.prompt import Prompt


class PromptComponent(CustomComponent):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "template": TemplateField(display_name="Template"),
            "code": TemplateField(advanced=True),
        }

    async def build(
        self,
        template: Prompt,
        **kwargs,
    ) -> Prompt:
        prompt = await Prompt.from_template_and_variables(template, kwargs)  # type: ignore
        self.status = prompt.format_text()
        return prompt
